intro: Tylopsacas cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tylopsacas, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
